title: Bizarre moment Donald Trump and Melania put chocolate bar on young trick-or-treater’s head
text:
Donald Trump and Melania strangely placed candy bars on one child’s head, ignoring his outstretched hands and candy bag.

This is the strange moment Donald Trump and Melania placed chocolate bars on one young trick-or-treater’s head.

The president and first lady handed out candy bars to children in costumes at a pre-Halloween event on the White House South Lawn on Monday.

Everything seemed to be going smoothly for the president until one poor child dressed in a inflatable ‘Minion’ costume arrived at the front of the line.

The minion barreled through two small boys dressed as Spider-man to get to the president. Trump then welcomed the child by tapping on the head with the candy bar, as if making sure someone is inside the puffy yellow consume.

Trump ignored the minion’s outstretched hands and candy bag, and instead opted to place the candy bar directly on the child’s head. Melania then mimiced him and puts a second candy bar on top of the inflatable costume.

Unsurprisingly, the candy ded not remain on the minion’s rounded head for long. It slid off and fell to the floor almost immediately, but a staffer picked it up and places it in the child’s bag.

Trump and Melania appeared to find the strange situation humorous and could briefly be seen laughing to themselves. The minion remained nearby for a moment before shuffling away.

Clips of the bizarre interaction were shared online as people joked about the president’s trouble with the minion.

One Twitter user said: ‘Disrespecting the Minions could hurt Trump in key 2020 battleground states.’

Another tweeted: ‘If you don’t think Trump skipping over Spider-Man to give the minion a chocolate bar on his head instead of his treat bag is the best moment of his presidency, I don’t think we can be friends.’

One Reddit saw the interaction as symbolic of the country and joked: ‘It’s like the minion is America waiting for trickle-down economics.’
